meanings.definition: A device used to expel or remove something forcefully.
meanings.sent1: The ejectors in the vacuum cleaner help suck up dirt and debris.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic fixed the ejectors in the machine to ensure proper functioning.
meanings.sent3: The ejectors in the toy rocket made the astronaut figurine fly high into the air.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter acted like ejectors, pushing out all the sadness from the room.
meanings.sent5: The ejectors on the water gun shot out powerful streams of water.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that ejects or causes ejection.
meanings.sent1: The superhero was known as the ejectors of villains from the city.
meanings.sent2: The coach praised the goalkeeper as the team's best ejectors of the ball.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat became the ejectors of all the papers on the desk.
meanings.sent4: His words were like ejectors, pushing people away with their harshness.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind acted as the ejectors of leaves from the tree branches.
